title: Graphs of angular velocity with respect to time

content.question:
A disk is initially rotating counterclockwise around a fixed axis with angular speed w0.

At time t = 0, the two forces shown in the figure above are exerted on the disk. If counterclockwise is positive, which of the following could show the angular velocity of the disk as a function of time?

choices.label: Option A consists of a graph in the first and fourth quadrants. The horizontal axis is labeled t, the vertical axis is labeled omega, and the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes is labeled O. The figure shows a graph beginning on the vertical axis at negative omega sub zero and is a straight line up and to the right.

Option B consists of a graph in the first and fourth quadrants. The horizontal axis is labeled t, the vertical axis is labeled omega, and the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes is labeled O. The figure shows a graph beginning on the vertical axis at negative omega sub zero and is a straight horizontal line to the right.

Option C consists of a graph in the first and fourth quadrants. The horizontal axis is labeled t, the vertical axis is labeled omega, and the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes is labeled O. The figure shows a graph beginning on the vertical axis at omega sub zero and is a straight line down and to the right.

Option D consists of a graph in the first and fourth quadrants. The horizontal axis is labeled t, the vertical axis is labeled omega, and the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes is labeled O. The figure shows a graph beginning on the vertical axis at omega sub zero and is a straight line down and to the right to the horizontal axis at a point about half way along the horizontal axis. The graph is then a straight line up and to the right.

content.answer: Option C consists of a graph in the first and fourth quadrants. The horizontal axis is labeled t, the vertical axis is labeled omega, and the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes is labeled O. The figure shows a graph beginning on the vertical axis at omega sub zero and is a straight line down and to the right.
